text: [Music]
[Music]
[Music]
[Music]
this is our latest look at the McLaren
P1 it's one of the most anticipated
hypercars in recent memory and faces
stiff competition from the likes of the
Porsche 918 spider and laf
Ferrari first the headlines the P1 is a
technical TDE force and is powered by a
3.8 L twint turbocharged V8 engine in
conjunction with an electric motor
producing a combined output of 903 brake
horsepower that means the P1 is able to
accelerate to 62 mph in under 3 seconds
and on to a top speed of 2117
mph it can also be a very green car
managing an official 34 MPG on a
combined cycle and emitting 194 G per km
of
CO2 the P1 is built around a carbon
fiber tub known as the monocage this tub
weighs 90 kilos and includes space for
all of the p1's electrical systems as
well as its
battery Mclaren has been obsessed with
saving weight in the P1 so much so that
the wind screen has been plain down to
become just 3.2 mm thick 1 mm thinner
than that used on the 12C and 3 and 1/2
kilos
lighter the diet continues inside where
each seat weighs just 10.5 kilos it's
joined by a carbon fiber trim which does
without its top layer of resin McLaren
says this gives a more natural look and
crucially saves another 1.5
kilos don't think of the P1 as only for
the track however McLaren tells us its
engine neared the hypercar to ride as
well around town as it does on the
circuit it suspension system is again
based on the 12C but uses special
hydraulic adjustment to control ride
height and vertical
stiffness in some cases the Space Age
Technology showcased on the P1 really is
from space a silicon carbide coating
used to give the carbon ceramic brakes
their stopping power generating up to 2G
in places was first used on the Ariana
space
rocket at
$866,000 each the P1 is likely to be a
rare and exclusive machine just 375
models will be produced in total all of
which have already sold out
[Music]
